data.text: @mecfs_sa Agree with other replies, this is clumsy and unkind.  also agree with you that pw MECFS do not have #FND because it’s not actually neurological
@DarkWaters13 @mecfs_sa PM me and we can talk. I can explain. My FND does the same.

@savina93643891 @mecfs_sa Oh wait, but it doesn't have to be in the area that controls emotions! Just that it can be. Have to go, will read the article later (I have FND that affects my walking and sometimes cognition but never emotions)

@savina93643891 @mecfs_sa Yes, you're right: this has been updated since the DSM-V. And yes, thanks for this -- it means that FND is an illness just like CFS: some don't like the name because of how that named illness used to be understood, but the medical understanding has changed.

@DarkWaters13 @mecfs_sa Actually it’s not all FND patients must have psych trauma but must have trauma. As in traumatic event physical or psychiatric resulting in physical. FND is a physical event in the brain happening in the area that also controls emotions. https://t.co/f6LfE0mdPK

@Scrumbles1 @mecfs_sa The knowledge of what #FND actually is makes a difference. Yes there are wrong diagnosis but that’s does not mean that those with FND need to be told their disorder is not real. https://t.co/30Qa1dymaW

@mecfs_sa Hi, FND is a real illness, just because you don’t have it doesn’t mean it doesn’t exist. Perpetuating the idea that ‘it’s all in your head’ leads to a situation where people don’t get the care they need. Both conditions can coexist without having to delegitimise the other :)
@mecfs_sa #FND is not made up and the people who have it are not pretending. You do harm when you spread false information. https://t.co/EyHzPiD5Ym
